Move to select and pinch to resize. The cropped image will be used on your device home screen.
Unable to load the selected photo.
Pinch to resize and reposition. The cropped image will be used as the background on your Clock and Home screens. Your device will automatically switch to a Personal Photo Theme.
By uploading a background image you agree to the Amazon Drive and Prime Photos <font color=#0070BA>Terms of Use</font> and acknowledge that a copy of the image will be saved in Prime Photos.
By uploading a background image, you agree that the image will be accessed and temporarily stored in the cloud as part of the upload process.
Alexa hands free is available on your %1$s smartphone.
To get started, download the %1$s app.
Alexa can now recognize your voice
If you skip, you will not be able to use Alexa hands free. You can return to the Alexa hands-free setup at any time by going to More > Settings > Alexa app Settings > Alexa hands free.
Talk to Alexa on the go. If you choose, Alexa can respond even when your phone is locked.

Alexa hands-free setup will be incomplete unless you grant permissions to the %1$s app. To change your settings, visit the info page for the %1$s app, tap \"Permissions\" and toggle on \"Microphone\".
This allows Alexa to hear your requests, make calls and send voice messages to friends and family, and help set up certain devices.
This allows %1$s to detect when you say “Alexa”.
To use Alexa Hands Free, you must choose \"While using the app\" when asked for permission to record audio.

Alexa hands free setup will be incomplete unless you grant permissions to the Alexa app. To change your settings, visit the information page for the Alexa app, tap \"Permissions\", and toggle on \"Microphone\".
Without granting this permission, location-related Alexa requests will not work.
Without granting this permission, Alexa hands free will not work.
To use Alexa Hands Free, you must choose \"While using the app.\"
Get Alexa responses on your lock screen when your phone is locked.

“Respond while locked” uses your phone’s voice recognition feature to identify you. This is not a secure feature. A person with a similar voice or recording of your voice could activate Alexa responses on this phone.
Enabling this option is not secure. A person with a similar voice or recording of your voice could activate Alexa responses on your phone. Turn this feature on or off later in Alexa settings.
Get Alexa responses on your lock screen when your phone is locked.
\"Alexa, how many calories did I burn?\"

I want Alexa to respond when my phone is locked, but not to requests involving my personal information.

If Alexa isn’t waking up to your voice, try deleting your voice training and setting up Alexa hands free again.

Distracted driving can lead to serious fatal and injury accident or property damage accident. To continue operation, first stop in a safe place. Pay close attention to road condition while driving. Do not prioritise operation of the device while driving. You are solely responsible for safe driving and compliance with laws and regulations regarding the use of electronic devices while driving. Keep your eyes on road signs, regulations and road condition. Gazing at the equipment or operating the equipment by hand while driving may violate the Road Traffic Act. For more safety information, go to the Alexa app and select \"Help and Feedback\" then \"Terms etc.\"
Warning! Do not operate the device by hand while driving.
Exit Auto mode and go to your lock\'s settings page to enable Unlock by App to use while driving.
\"Alexa, add milk to my shopping list\"
Interacting with your Alexa app while driving can be dangerous and result in serious injury, death or property damage. Please park your car in a safe location before continuing.
No saved Home or Work locations
Add a smart display to your car accessory
\"Alexa, take me to the first one\"

Enable Drop In

To get started, go to Device Settings, select the device you want to enable, tap Communication and then set permissions.
Drop In lets household members and contacts instantly connect to your Echo devices.\n

Enable Drop In

To get started, go to My Profile and tap to Allow Drop In.

When Drop In is enabled, this contact and their household members can instantly connect to your Echo devices for a video or voice conversation. Interactions with Alexa, and motion sensors on Echo Show, will be used to show a recently active indicator that lets them know whether you’re available.

When Drop In is enabled, you and your household members can instantly connect to your Echo devices for a video or voice conversation. Interactions with Alexa, and motion sensors on Echo Show, will be used to show a recently active indicator that lets household members know whether you’re available.
Drop In uses Alexa interactions and Echo Show’s motion sensors to let household members know whether you’re recently active. Learn more in Help & Feedback.
Instantly connect to your Echo for a chat by saying “Alexa, Drop In”.
You can manage Drop In settings on your contact card.
Contacts can drop in on my Echo devices
You are now able to speak to Alexa in two languages, such as Hindi and English. Visit Alexa app settings to change your language.
Speak to Alexa in two languages
To call and message friends and family with Alexa and your existing telephone provider, the Alexa app needs permission to:
• make, receive and manage phone calls;
• send, receive and read SMS messages; and
• Check the status of your connected phone, including current mobile network information, and the status of any ongoing calls.
• Transfer active calls to your mobile phone.

To teach Alexa to recognize your voice, update your privacy settings in the Alexa app or amazon.com/alexaprivacysettings to anything but \"Don\'t save recordings\". This allows Alexa to save your voice recordings when you create a voice ID. Your voice ID will be stored in the cloud until you delete it.

For Alexa to accurately respond to your request, allow access to location. This allows you to use location-based features such as getting local results, helping to make device setup easier and more.

For Alexa to accurately respond to your request, allow access to location. This allows you to use location-based features, such as getting local results, helping to make device setup easier and more. To allow: 

1) Tap the link below, then select "Permissions" 

2) Select Location, then "While using the app." 

3) Return to the Alexa app and repeat your request.

To teach Alexa to recognize your voice, update your privacy settings in the Alexa app or amazon.com/alexaprivacysettings to anything except “Don\'t save recordings”. This allows Alexa to save your voice recordings when you create a voice profile. Your voice will be stored in the cloud until you delete it.

To change your settings: 
 1. Go to settings and tap “Alexa Privacy”. 
 2. Tap “Manage Your Alexa Data”. 
 3. Choose any option other than “Don't save recordings”. 
 4. Return to the Alexa app. 
 *This change may take up to 24 hours to update.
You\'ll need to update your privacy settings
